Manx: Rosh nee ad geamagh neems clashtyn
English: Before they call I will listen
Diplomatic: Rosh nee ad geamagh neems clashtyn

Manx: Ren sharvaant aeg goll un laa gys e benainshter, lesh aigney feer seaghnit er yn oyr nagh row ee er chlashtyn voish e moir v’ee cha graihagh urree, son tra liauyr as v’ee smooinaght dy row red ennagh er haghyrt jee ec y thie ny dy beagh ee er screeu huick. Ren yn venainshter gra ree dy cheau ooilley e kiarailyn eck er yn Çhiarn Yeesey as gyn dy ve ceaut sheese myr v’ee. Ren yn sharvaant geaishtagh ree dy arryltagh as streeu dy yannoo myr ren e benainshter gra ree as loayrt rish Jee mychione yn oyr shoh.
English: A young servant went one day to her mistress with heavy sorrow in her mind because she hadn’t heard from her mother, who she was so fond of, for a long time, and she was thinking that something had happened to her, at the house, or she would have written to her. The mistress said to her to cast all her cares on the Lord Jesus and not to be downcast as she was. The servant listened to her willingly and strived to do as the mistress told her and spoke to the Lord about this reason.
Diplomatic: Ren shervaant eag ghool un laa gys y Ben anshter, lesh aigney feer seaghnyt  er yn oyr nagh row ee er clashtyn voish y Moir vee cha graihagh urree, son tra louyr as vee smooinniagh dy row red ennagh er haghyrt jee, ec y thie ne dy bagh ee er scrieu hick. Ren yn ven anshter gra ree dy cheau ooilley y caarrailyn eck er yn Chiarn yeesey as gyn dy ve cheaut sheese mor vee, ren yn sharvaant geashtagh ree dy arryltagh as strieu dy yannoo myr ren y ben anshter gra ree as loyrt rish Jee mychione yn oyr shoh.

Manx: Cre cha leah as haink yn ansoor. Moghrey laa ny vairagh haink yn inneen gys e benanshter lesh eddin ghennal, as gra rish yn venainshter, “O ta mee er gheddyn screeunyn”.
English: How soon the answer came. On the morning of the next day, the girl came to the mistress with a cheerful face and said to the mistress “Oh, I have received letters.”
Diplomatic: cre cha lheah as haink yn ansoor. Moghry laa ny vairagh haink yn inneen gys y benanshter lesh eddyn gennal, as gra rish yn venanshter, O ta mee er gheddyn scrieuyn.

Manx: Cre’n oyr dy row ee cha moarnagh jeh ny screeunyn? Er yn oyr dy row ee er gheddyn ad ayns ansoor da padjer.
English: Why was she so proud of the letters? Because she had received them in answer to prayer.
Diplomatic: Cre’n oyr dy row ee cha moarnagh jeh ny scrieuyn. er yn oyr dy row ee er gheddyn ad ayns ansoor da padjer.

Manx: Paart dy cheayrtyn ta Jee freayl shin farkiagh son ansoor gys nyn badjeryn, agh eck keayrtyn elley, myr er yn oyr shoh, t’eh gansoor ad feer tappee. t’Eeh clashtyn ayns dagh traa, agh er yn oyr dy hrial nyn credjue t’Eh ny cheayrtyn lhiggey shaghey dy chur ansoor dooin. Lhig dooin er-y-fa shen, gyn dy bragh jannoo meechredjue nagh vel Eh clashtyn agh credjal dy shicker dy jean Eh ayns E hraa mie hene cur ansoor dooin as cur dooin yeearree nyn ghreeghyn, ayns E hraa hene, as er yn aght Echey hene.
English: Sometimes God keeps you waiting waiting for an answer to your prayers, but at other times, like this time, he answers very quickly. He hears at all times. He sometimes delays giving us an answer. Let us therefore not ever lose faith; that he doesn’t hear, but believe surely that he will, in his own good time, give us an answer and give us the desire of our hearts in his own time and in his own way.
Diplomatic: paart dy cheayrtyn Ta Jee freeal shin farkiagh son ansoor gys nyn badjeryn, agh eck cheayrtyn elley, myr er yn oyr shoh, te gansoor ad feer thappee. Te clashtyn ayns dagh tra, agh er yn oyr dy chrial nyn credjue Te ny cheayrtyn liggey shiaghey dy cur ansoor doin. lhig doin er y fa shen, gyn dy braagh jannoo meechredjue, nagh vel eh clashtyn agh credjal dy shiker dy jean eh ayns y chra mie hene cur ansoor doin as cur doin yeeree nyn ghreeghyn, ayns y chra hene, as er yn aght eck eh hene.
